instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power with Trackpad
threads.message:
Hi Team,

Last week I've fixed a 00045 board after reflowing the CPU (common failure), the machine turns ON and boots fine only if I unplug the trackpad on the end of the flex ribbon.......flex ribbon which is new.
I'm waiting for a new trackpad to arrive to test.
I think ( not sure at 100% ) that after fixing it, I've turned the flex ribbon upside down, and maybe that would be the reason.
If I turn ON the machine, then plug the trackpad, it suddenly turns OFF, like I have a short to gnd.

Also I've noticed that <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_TPAD_FLT</SIGNAL> is mesuring in diode mode,  0.0002V (short to gnd ) with the trackpad connected VS 0.457V without trackpad
I think that if the issue would come from the motherboard it wouldn't even turns ON.......that's why I think the tracpad is faulty
What do you think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power with Trackpad
threads.message: If you have short only with trackpad connected, why doubt???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power with Trackpad
threads.message:
Yes you're right......wait the new trackpad and see

Thanks
